definitions: showing exceptional courage, determination, and willingness to take risks
displaying a bold, spirited attitude with energetic confidence
examples: The gutsy reporter confronted the corrupt politician directly
Her gutsy decision to start a business impressed everyone
The band's gutsy performance electrified the entire crowd
He made a gutsy move challenging the champion

definitions: produced in the throat with a harsh, rasping quality of sound
having a rough, harsh quality suggesting primitive or raw emotion
examples: His guttural voice made the ancient chant more haunting
The actor practiced guttural sounds for the warrior role
The beast let out a guttural growl from deep within
Her guttural scream expressed pure primal terror

definitions: relating to or used in the sport of gymnastics or physical exercises
requiring or displaying remarkable physical agility and flexibility of movement
examples: The gymnastic equipment filled the entire training facility
She enrolled her daughter in gymnastic classes
His gymnastic leap over the fence amazed the spectators
The dancer's gymnastic movements defied gravity

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine dealing with women's reproductive system and health
examples: She scheduled her annual gynaecological examination next week
The hospital opened a new gynaecological ward
The gynaecological surgeon specialized in minimally invasive procedures
Regular gynaecological checkups are important for women's health

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine dealing with women's reproductive system and health
examples: The gynecological exam revealed no abnormalities
She pursued specialized training in gynecological oncology
The clinic offers comprehensive gynecological services for all ages
Modern gynecological procedures have become much less invasive

definitions: relating to or using a gyroscope for maintaining orientation and angular velocity
examples: The drone uses gyroscopic stabilization for smooth flight
Gyroscopic forces help motorcycles stay upright while moving
The ship's gyroscopic compass remained accurate despite rough seas
Modern smartphones contain gyroscopic sensors for screen rotation

definitions: suitable or safe for people to live in with adequate conditions
examples: Scientists search for habitable planets beyond our solar system
The renovations made the old building habitable again
Mars might become habitable with advanced terraforming technology
The apartment was barely habitable after the flood damage

definitions: done regularly or repeatedly as a normal pattern of behavior
doing something constantly or compulsively, often with negative implications
examples: His habitual morning routine never varies during weekdays
She took her habitual seat by the window
The habitual liar couldn't stop deceiving everyone around him
Police arrested the habitual offender for another crime

definitions: lacking originality or freshness due to overuse; trite and predictable
examples: The movie relied on hackneyed plot devices and clichés
His hackneyed phrases made the speech incredibly boring
She avoided hackneyed expressions in her creative writing
The hackneyed storyline failed to engage modern audiences

definitions: looking exhausted and unwell, especially from fatigue, worry, or suffering
examples: His haggard face showed the strain of sleepless nights
The refugees looked haggard after their dangerous journey
She appeared haggard following weeks of caring for her sick child
The haggard expression on his face worried his friends

definitions: having a particular type or color of hair, used in combinations
examples: The long-haired musician strummed his guitar on stage
A red-haired woman entered the crowded restaurant
The fair-haired child played happily in the garden
Dark-haired actors were preferred for the historical drama

definitions: having no hair or fur on the skin or body surface
examples: The hairless cat required special care in cold weather
His completely hairless head gleamed under the lights
Some breeds of dogs are naturally hairless
The chemotherapy left her temporarily hairless but determined

definitions: covered with a lot of hair or hair-like growths
informal: frightening, dangerous, or difficult to handle
examples: The hairy spider crawled across the bathroom floor
His hairy arms were visible beneath rolled-up sleeves
The mountain road became hairy during the thunderstorm
That was a hairy situation with the angry customer

definitions: permissible or lawful according to Islamic law, especially regarding food
examples: The restaurant serves only halal meat to its customers
She looked for halal certification on food products
The halal butcher shop opened near the mosque
Many airlines now offer halal meal options

definitions: denoting a period of time that was idyllically happy and peaceful
examples: She remembered the halcyon days of her youth fondly
The halcyon years before the war seemed impossibly distant
Those halcyon summer afternoons by the lake were unforgettable
The company enjoyed halcyon growth during the economic boom

definitions: showing strong health and vigor, especially in old age
examples: The hale elderly gentleman walked five miles every morning
At ninety, she remained hale and hearty
Despite his age, he looked hale enough to work
The hale constitution he inherited served him well

definitions: made holy or sacred; greatly honored and respected
examples: Students walked through the hallowed halls of the ancient university
The hallowed ground of the battlefield became a memorial
These hallowed traditions have been preserved for centuries
He spoke in hallowed tones about his mentor

definitions: experiencing false sensory perceptions that appear real but are not
examples: The hallucinating patient saw things that weren't there
High fever left him hallucinating throughout the night
The hallucinating witness gave unreliable testimony to police
She was hallucinating after days without sleep

definitions: having the quality of hallucinations; bizarre, dreamlike, or surreal
examples: The artist created hallucinatory images that defied logic
The fever produced hallucinatory visions throughout the night
His hallucinatory writing style confused many readers
The film's hallucinatory sequences blurred reality and fantasy

definitions: causing hallucinations or altered perceptions when consumed or administered
examples: Scientists study hallucinogenic mushrooms for medical research
The hallucinogenic drug affected his perception of reality
Some hallucinogenic substances have therapeutic potential
Ancient cultures used hallucinogenic plants in religious ceremonies

definitions: archaic: walking with difficulty due to disability or injury; lame
examples: The halt beggar struggled along the cobblestone street
His halt gait revealed an old war injury
The horse's halt movement concerned the veterinarian
She walked with a halt step after the accident

definitions: stopping and starting repeatedly; lacking smooth continuous movement
speaking slowly with frequent pauses, showing uncertainty or difficulty
examples: His halting progress up the mountain worried the guides
The old machine made halting movements before breaking down
She gave a halting speech in the unfamiliar language
His halting explanation revealed his nervousness

definitions: shaped, beaten, or worked with a hammer into a particular form
informal: extremely intoxicated from alcohol consumption
examples: The hammered copper pot gleamed on the kitchen shelf
She wore hammered silver earrings to the party
He got completely hammered at his bachelor party
They were too hammered to drive home safely

definitions: using or designed for a particular hand, typically in combinations
examples: The left-handed scissors were perfect for her needs
Right-handed batters dominated the baseball team
A one-handed catch won the game for them
The two-handed sword required considerable strength

definitions: designed to be held and operated in the hand; portable
examples: The handheld scanner made inventory checks much easier
She played games on her handheld gaming device
The doctor used a handheld ultrasound for quick diagnosis
Handheld computers revolutionized mobile work

definitions: having a physical or mental disability that limits movement, senses, or activities
examples: The building installed ramps for handicapped access
Handicapped parking spaces are located near entrances
The handicapped athlete competed in the Paralympic games
Special programs support handicapped students in schools

definitions: equipped with a handle or handles for carrying or holding
managed or dealt with in a particular way
examples: The handled basket made shopping much easier
She preferred handled mugs for her morning coffee
The well-handled crisis enhanced the company's reputation
A poorly handled situation can damage relationships

definitions: made by hand rather than by machine, often implying superior quality
examples: She treasured the handmade quilt from her grandmother
The handmade chocolates cost more but tasted incredible
Local artisans sold handmade jewelry at the market
Each handmade violin had its unique character

definitions: physically attractive in a strong, well-proportioned way, especially of men
substantial, generous, or considerable in size, amount, or extent
examples: The handsome actor won hearts in the romantic film
She married a handsome doctor from the hospital
They made a handsome profit from the investment
The charity received a handsome donation

definitions: written with a pen or pencil rather than typed or printed
examples: She cherished the handwritten letter from her grandmother
The handwritten notes were difficult to decipher
He sent handwritten invitations for the wedding
The handwritten manuscript was discovered in the attic

definitions: convenient to handle or use; useful and easy to reach
skilled at using one's hands or tools to fix things
examples: Keep a handy reference guide on your desk
The handy location made shopping very convenient
He's handy around the house fixing things
She's handy with power tools and machinery

definitions: lacking any obvious principle of organization; random and chaotic
examples: The haphazard arrangement of furniture made navigation difficult
Their haphazard planning resulted in complete chaos
Books were stacked in haphazard piles throughout the room
The haphazard approach to safety caused several accidents

definitions: unfortunate and deserving pity; having persistently bad luck
examples: The hapless victim fell for another online scam
A hapless tourist got lost in the unfamiliar city
The hapless team lost their tenth game in succession
She felt sorry for the hapless job candidate

definitions: feeling or showing pleasure, contentment, or joy
willing or pleased to do something; satisfied with
fortunate and convenient; characterized by good luck
examples: The happy children played in the sunshine
She felt happy after receiving good news
I'm happy to help with your project
We're happy with the election results
It was a happy coincidence meeting you here
By happy chance, they had one ticket left

definitions: relating to the sense of touch or tactile perception and feedback
examples: The phone's haptic feedback confirmed each button press
Haptic technology enhances virtual reality experiences
Surgeons use haptic gloves for remote operations
The haptic interface helps blind users navigate

definitions: feeling stressed and tired from persistent annoyance, pressure, or attack
examples: The harassed mother juggled work and three children
He looked harassed after dealing with complaints all day
The harassed employee finally quit her toxic job
Harassed witnesses refused to testify in court

definitions: having a rigid protective cover, as opposed to paperback
examples: The hardback edition costs twice as much as paperback
She collected first edition hardback novels
Libraries prefer hardback books for their durability
The hardback version included exclusive illustrations

definitions: uncompromising and dedicated to extreme beliefs or practices
depicting or involving explicit sexual activity
examples: The hardcore fans never miss a single game
She's a hardcore environmentalist who lives off-grid
The website was blocked for hardcore content
Police investigated the hardcore pornography ring

definitions: having a rigid protective cover, typically for books
examples: The hardcover release preceded the paperback by six months
She prefers reading hardcover books despite the weight
Hardcover textbooks withstand heavy student use better
The author signed my hardcover copy at the event

definitions: made hard or harder through physical or chemical process
made tough and unfeeling through difficult experience
examples: The hardened steel blade cut through metal easily
Hardened concrete formed the building's foundation
The hardened criminal showed no remorse
Years of war created hardened soldiers

definitions: adhering to firm, uncompromising political or ideological positions
examples: The hardline stance on immigration divided the party
Hardline conservatives opposed any compromise
The government took a hardline approach to protesters
His hardline views alienated moderate supporters

definitions: putting considerable effort and dedication into work or tasks
examples: The hardworking student earned top grades through dedication
Hardworking employees received bonuses for their efforts
Her hardworking nature impressed all her colleagues
The hardworking farmer tended crops from dawn to dusk

definitions: capable of enduring difficult conditions; tough and resilient
examples: Hardy plants survived the harsh winter temperatures
The hardy explorer crossed the frozen tundra
These hardy vegetables grow well in poor soil
Hardy mountain people adapted to high altitude living

definitions: causing or likely to cause harm, injury, or damage
examples: Smoking has harmful effects on your health
The harmful chemicals contaminated the water supply
Harmful radiation requires protective equipment
Spreading harmful rumors destroyed her reputation

definitions: not able or likely to cause harm, damage, or injury
examples: The snake looked scary but was completely harmless
Their harmless prank made everyone laugh
Most spiders are harmless to humans
The medication has harmless side effects

definitions: relating to or characterized by musical harmony or harmonics
examples: The harmonic progression created a beautiful sound
Harmonic analysis revealed the song's structure
The guitar's harmonic overtones enriched the melody
She studied harmonic theory at the conservatory

definitions: forming a pleasing or consistent whole; in agreement
having parts that combine well together aesthetically or musically
examples: The team worked in harmonious cooperation
Their harmonious relationship lasted fifty years
The harmonious blend of colors pleased the eye
The choir produced harmonious melodies

definitions: brought into agreement or made compatible with a standard
examples: The harmonised regulations apply across all member states
Their harmonised approach improved efficiency
Harmonised standards facilitate international trade
The harmonised database merged information from multiple sources

definitions: brought into agreement or made compatible with a standard
examples: The harmonized tariff schedule simplified international shipping
Harmonized accounting standards improved transparency
Their harmonized efforts produced excellent results
The harmonized color scheme unified the design

definitions: controlled and used for a particular purpose, especially energy or power
examples: The harnessed water power generated electricity for the town
Harnessed solar energy reduced their utility bills
The harnessed potential of employees increased productivity
Scientists studied harnessed fusion reactions
